page.title: 11COMMUNICATION CODICOTEWELWYN
page.content: Telephones - British Telecom has two public telephone exchanges; one in Welwyn and one in Codicote. Local calls go direct, other calls via the switching centre in Stevenage. London Radiophone provides a mobile service. Cellular UHF Radio, a new system for mobile subscribers, uses higher radio frequencies. Paging Service uses UHF radio frequencies and is computer controlled. Each subscriber is allocated a number and a small pocket receiver. Other radio services operated are Police, Fire, Ambulance, Taxi, Water- board, Gas, Electricity, Aircraft, Amateur Radio and Citizens Band Radio. Postal Services - Welwyn and Codicote each have a Sub Post Office and a number of Post and Telephone Call Boxes.
